docs.text: the first in a very long list of things wrong with " i still know what you did last summer " is the title .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: think about it for a second .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: if the last movie was called " i know what you did last summer " , wouldn't the next movie have to be " i still know what you did two summers ago " ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: if anyone working on this movie had an i . q .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: greater than five would have thought about it logically and said , " hey . . .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: wait a minute " .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but alas , the people behind this film are obviously idiots , so i won't hold them to that .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: what i will hold them to is the fact that they have a pretty bad movie on their hands , even for a teenage slasher flick .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i guess i'm one of the few critics who actually kind of liked the original film ( emphasis on the " kind of " ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it wasn't great or anything and maybe not even necessarily good , but at least it didn't have me glancing at my watch every minute or so like it's sequel did .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there are just so many problems with this movie that it's hard trying to figure out where to start .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: first of all , i guess , is the setting .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the movie offers no rational reason why the film had to take place in the bahamas , other than the fact that the producers wanted a seaside setting .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: exactly why does the fisherman want to go through all the trouble of faking a radio contest to get julie james ( jennifer love hewitt , one of the only survivors of the first film ) and her new college buddies out to the islands before he hacks them up ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the movie suffers from this kind of logic all the way through .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in one scene , julie is in a tanning booth at a deserted gym when the hooked fisherman with the slicker comes in and seals up the booth so the damsel in distress can't get out , no matter how hard she tries .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: when julie discovers she's going to slowly fry to death , she screams for help and her friends come to her rescue .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: now , this is all fine and dandy except for one thing ; instead of spending five minutes trying to bust open the booth , why not just turn the freakin' thing off ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in another scene , one of the characters , after having their significant other all but decapitated by the man in the slicker , says to julie , " just don't tell anybody it rained the whole time . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: oh yeah , i've just been terrorized by a hook wielding sociopath and had some of my best friends gruesomely slaughtered , but hey , i'll crack jokes anyway .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: after all , it is in the script .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film's only saving graces are a few well-executed suspense sequences and a really cool cameo by the " re-animator himself , jeffrey combs .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he brings some good comic relief and life to an otherwise limp movie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: way to go , jeffrey .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i have a hunch that the reason this film fizzles while the first one at least kept it's head above water is the recent absence of writer kevin williamson .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: with " scream " and even it's sequel , he displayed a real talent as a screenwriter .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: his ear for dialogue and the terrific endings he puts on all his films make him a standout from all the rest of the horror writers , and i think " i still know " has really suffered by not having him on board .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the cool atmosphere is still there this time around , but i just didn't like the characters or the writing as much as i did in the first one .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: even though the movie doesn't have williamson , it still has a hacky ending , trying to do what kevin did with the first two " scream " s by ( some may consider this a spoiler , but if you have seen any horror movies whatsoever , then you should be able to guess the identity of the madman within twenty minutes ) having two killers and , this time , having one of them being a family member to the other .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i think someone in the audience put it best when , after the movie had ended with another " the killer is back ! "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: cliffhanger , he said " who is this time , the grandma ? "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: all in all , " i still know " tries to be as successful as the first the film was , but really fails in the attempt .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i mean , it's okay when slasher movies rip-off each other , but when they start copying themselves . . .
docs.label: negative
